content.question: The Maclaurin series for <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 1 plus x squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is <math alttext="1 minus x squared, plus x to the fourth power, minus x to the sixth power, plus dot dot dot, plus, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n power, times x raised to the 2 n power, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></math>. Which of the following is a power series expansion for <math alttext="x times the inverse tangent of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 2 x, plus 12 times x cubed, minus 30 times x to the fifth power, plus 64 times x to the seventh power, minus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>64</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the fourth power over 4, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the sixth power over 6, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the eighth power over 8, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="x squared, minus the fraction x to the fourth power over 3, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the sixth power over 5, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the eighth power over 7, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="x squared, minus the fraction x to the fourth power over 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the sixth power over 5 factorial, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the eighth power over 7 factorial, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x squared, minus the fraction x to the fourth power over 3, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the sixth power over 5, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the eighth power over 7, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 10.15: (BC ONLY) Representing Functions as Power Series

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
